numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed that an applicant has a large advantage in getting into an elite school if the parents of the applicant attended the school and the applicant has a high income.
2. I noticed that legacy status always gives an applicant an advantage over an applicant who has no relative who attended the college.
3. I wonder which college is the most biased toward the legacy boost.
4. I wonder why there is a small dip right before the rise in the chart.
5. I wonder how the people who attend the school would vary if the colleges did not have this information.
7. I am currently a junior in high school.
8. I will look into college very soon.
9. When I apply to colleges, I will think about this issue.
10. I think that my chance of getting into a school that my parents did not attend will be lower than my chance of getting into a school that my parents attended.
11. The headline is: Ivy League or Legacy League.
